verbs.description: remap (third-person singular simple present remaps, present participle remapping, simple past and past participle remapped)

entries.meaning: To assign differently; to relabel or repurpose.
examples: He remapped the variable in the code to hold the value directly, instead of a pointer to the value.
Because the topography and development of the land changed so much in the floods, the region had to be remapped.
